website_summaries.verdict: One of the best high-end light meters for anyone wanting the most accurate readings and results.
pros: Individual light sensor and 12- to 24-inch coil make it easy to take different readings without moving the display
Controls are easy to navigate while using the meter
cons: Light level indicator can drift up when reading the same light source for a long period of time

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  Fair price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the commercial lighting business, and I use this product for reading foot candles nearly every day. It's a bit bulky and I wish they'd figure out a way to incorporate the sensor into the unit so you're not always having to use both hands to use the device (the sensor is always flopping around while I'm using the device and juggling a notebook and so on). Seems to be well made and durable. Seems to be quite accurate. The device was more than I wanted to spend on such a tool, but it was recommended to me by others in the industry and it's living up to its reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I use these for restaurant inspections as a health inspector. It is small enough and light so I don't mind carrying it in my tool bag everyday. It's a luxury item, because most inspectors could care less about proper light levels when there are so many facilities with bad food temps. I mainly use it on new construction, when they have the ability to make adjustments more easily. Works well. Just pop off the protective black cover to reveal the white frosted dome and start reading.
customer_reviews.author: 5T1CK5

customer_reviews.title: If it's not broke, don't fix it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light meter since it's the exact model the AHJ uses. The model I bought is slightly different than the inspectors and electricians already have, and the change was unnecessary and irritating. They added a push button to allow the battery cover to slide off, which is located in the middle of the back of the meter body, so the light meter doesn't sit flat on the ground anymore. Other than that, it's a good meter at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandjlo

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive photometer
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive light meter that is worth the price. Only issues are 1 - readings drift up in value over a few minutes and 2 - no calibration certificate of any sort. A NIST certificate would be pretty pricy, however some sort indication of calibration would be nice. I compared this unit for stability under indoor lighting next to my International Light photometer. The Extech drifted significantly more than the other meter. Then again it costs a fraction as much and is portable.
customer_reviews.author: Roger the Consultant

customer_reviews.title: Quality meter without the wires
customer_reviews.text: For the price, works great. Purchased this for use in acquiring night light meter readings on roadways. It allows for lux or foot candle measurements. The instruction manual covers the quirky min/max average function. Otherwise, it did a great job on the jobsite. The included bag provides for good storage and the device is sturdy and works good in a commercial environment. The only issue is there is no back light, which made night readings a little difficult. The fact that the light meter was integrated into the device meant there was no additional wires to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent form factor, very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Very good device - excellent form factor for performing walk-around surveys, portable and with good battery life. Features are user friendly and do not require a manual to figure out. Self-calibrating feature is an excellent touch for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one day
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for testing at work...the meter worked fine the first day, had good sensitivity and dynamic range. But it broke the second day and we had to buy another one. It just stopped taking measurements. We did all the normal things, replaced the battery, checked cables and fuse, but it was permanently broken.
customer_reviews.author: Zirt

customer_reviews.title: Really like this meter
customer_reviews.text: I really like this meter. It is very easy to use. Several engineers at work have borrowed it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bturner7

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Portable and easy to use! Use it for temporary lighting measurements. (Puts the general contractor in their place lol)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Martin

customer_reviews.title: No certifications paperwork!
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with any official certifications. If you need a certificate outlining the calibrations for insurance or manufacturing purposes (we use the meters in ASME testing) then you need to go through Extech themselves or through someone like McMaster Carr who can get you those certs. Other than that, the meter was in perfect condition! Worked great, wasn't damaged in any way. The box was a little beat up but the product was fine.
customer_reviews.author: VStar

customer_reviews.title: Solid light meter, higher quality than the average light meter.
customer_reviews.text: A good lumen/lux meter that is a cut above the others on the market. Extech got it right on the higher quality materials on this meter.
customer_reviews.author: DutchBreeze

customer_reviews.title: Orchid growers, this may not be the meter for you
customer_reviews.text: Andy's Orchids posts light requirements in footcandles (fc), ranging from 500 to 3,750. This meter only reads to 2,000 fc. Wish I'd noticed that before I bought it. Seems nice for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Richman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Accurate, I have compared to more expensive brands that friends have and it performs really well
customer_reviews.author: Mr N.

customer_reviews.title: Light Fanstatic
customer_reviews.text: Extech 401027 Pocket Sized Foot Candle Light Meter The light meter is easy to use and produced stable repeatable readings. The remote sensor permits the collection of light at one point while maintaining a comfortable position during the reading of the result. The Extech makes for a very affordable general illumination light meter and can be used for determining illumination levels in cinema applications.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great company, Great product.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got crapped out, so I called they company that makes them, and they sent me a new one. Great company. New one works great! very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: jott

customer_reviews.title: Easy and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product since i needed a calibrated meter for work and it works flawlessly. The active readout is awesome with the ability to have the reception dome stretched away from the meter. We purchased the calibrated version and received the proper documentation with it. Great product and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: PistolShrimp

customer_reviews.title: I returned my LT45 - Here's why:
customer_reviews.text: The meter's display is not back lit so it is impossible to read at night. The detached measuring head means that two hands are required to operate the unit. So taking notes while making measurements is difficult if not impossible. I returned the unit because I found that it could not be calibrated. Other Extech meters can be calibrated. Why not this one?? It is said to measure colored LED light levels, which is why I ordered it. It simply did not fit my application.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I use a light meter almost daily. Most meters are large and have an attached cord making it more difficult to use. This meter is sleek, accurate and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rangerider

customer_reviews.title: Use the on-line manual ! Hard copy appears to have an error.
customer_reviews.text: Meter appears to work fine, however there appears to be an error in the instruction manual that came with it. On p6 the L2 to L4 colours appear to wrong. I went on-line and the e-version of the manual I found had what I believe are the correct colours L2 Red, L3 Yellow, L4 Green. My data made a lot more sense after I applied these. It took a long time to sort out though. Otherwise OK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Works great, sensitive, durable and very affordable. If you just need to know relative light levels and are not concerned with hyper-accurate values, you can't beat the Ex-tech LT300. For me this a very good QA/QC tool for comparing scientific instrument consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Would not Pass 3 rd Party Calibration. JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Would not Pass 3 rd party certification. Cost Me $120.00. Can not find way to return it?
customer_reviews.author: Carles Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Its a great product and does just as much as some of the more expensive high end illuminance meters. The backlit screen is very helpful when trying to take readings in low light levels.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Works as indicated
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for a broad brush lighting study. Functionality a little cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: randazzle

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensing morning sunrise!
customer_reviews.text: Use it for detecting sunrise and morning start time at the job site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This light meter is extremely simple to use. Just turn on the power, remove the rubber cap on the sensor, and place it where you want to take a reading. It doesn't get any simpler than this. The meter seems to be very repeatable as well. I recommend this meter to anyone looking for quick measurements of lighting at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus Meridius

customer_reviews.title: This meter has a great reputation and delivers good service
customer_reviews.text: High quality meter at the right price. Used professionally. This meter has a great reputation and delivers good service.
customer_reviews.author: New England

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate meter
customer_reviews.text: Meter is easy to use and accurate. Works in many applications
customer_reviews.author: coffee drinker

customer_reviews.title: Worked great when comparing different LED output intensity over a small ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as documented. I use it for comparative measurements, so am not counting on absolute accuracy. Worked great when comparing different LED output intensity over a small viewing angle.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: This meter works very well, seems to built rugged, and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R Rajala

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gift for a son. He felt it would hit his need.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product met my every expectation and was just what i needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well and I appreciate dual units readout lux and candle power
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Good price.
customer_reviews.text: This was for me. Worked perfectly for why I needed it. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to monitor backstage lighting in a concert hall. It is quick to take a reading and easy to use. Seems to be extremely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Extech Candle Light Meter
customer_reviews.text: The Extech Candle Light Meter has performed flawlessly. Actually significantly better that similar meters at almost twice the price. One of the outstanding characteristics of the meter is its ability to give repeat readings, under the same conditions, that are almost identical. I would recommend it to anyone needing accurate measurement of candle light.
customer_reviews.author: Marek Alapin

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Easy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and compact. Without a back light it is hard to read at night.
customer_reviews.author: BudL

customer_reviews.title: Compact, affordable. I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this compact size versus my previous Extech LT300. The old meter died after 5 years and needed a replacement. This is the "LED compatible" version so I can get accurate readings no matter what type of lighting I'm measuring. The sensor is built into the unit instead of attached to a cord. I like that better because no cord to get tangled and I don't need 2 hands to do my readings (since I normally have something else in the other hand). Easy to use, easy to read - hope it lasts at least 5 years!
customer_reviews.author: Travis H

customer_reviews.title: Great product, no problems
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful general-purpose light meter. Consistent and reliable. It won't cover the range up to full sunlight (10,000 FC) but you can make or buy a cheap filter.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Abrams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The Extech LT300 was recommended by a co-worker. I am in the commercial/industrial LED lighting business and need to do lighting audits for prospective clients. This device is very easy to use and understand, and the results are very consistent. I only wish it had a backlight for the display to make reading it easier. I recommend this meter.
customer_reviews.author: EEL

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Meter
customer_reviews.text: Product is inaccurate. Understanding a light meter is a tool, I have used it for the past month as such. Readings were, at times, suspect. It wasn't until last week when with some colleagues with calibrated light meters, it was shown that this product (or at least the one I received) was measuring about 30% high. Not a good thing. Of course my 30-day return window closed last week...so landfill or paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: Lumens versus Candle Light is debatable, but this Extech does the trick
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for work to determine correct cabdle light for all the team members, office, manufacturing and support functions and it is very easy to use and provided what we needed; facts and data. The neat thing is that this moved us to converting to a full Office Cree LED lighting system, saving money on kWh. It was a win-win project.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact unit measures fC levels accurately. Great portable tool for lighting pro's.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Sobota

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for measuring ambient light in a room when specifying a projector and screen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great and easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: received and inserted battery, read instructions , works great easy to understand and a gift that made someone happy. thanks all.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, accurate light meter
customer_reviews.text: The candle light meter is inexpensive compared to others I looked at. It is extremely easy to use, lightweight and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Basic light meter
customer_reviews.text: I own several light meters and wanted a smaller one I could fit in my pocket for job walks. Works great. Sometimes the FC jump all around so I find I have to turn it off and back on again to reset it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Second One
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I have purchased. Both have worked well and I have been happy with them. The cap that protects the sensor can get in the way, but that is very minor.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: The service was perfect the product not so
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two units, the units worked perfectly on the first day, on the second day one of the units stopped working. The service from Amazon was perfect I received a new unit after one day. 10 days after I received the replacement it also stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good investment. I bought it for some tests in ...
customer_reviews.text: Good investment. I bought it for some tests in mi job, my co-workers are now interest too. In my country is difficult find this equipment, excellent price
customer_reviews.author: Ssalazar

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this device
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this device. Not even close to what true readings are when compared to the more expensive Light Meters my team has. I don't even use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Agliata

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to manage at Night
customer_reviews.text: I like it but in the questions answered on the purchase by a previous buyer, it said that the display was illuminated; however, the display is not illuminated and I was having to read the dial by star light (quite difficult). It would also be nice if the sensor was part of the meter housing because it is difficult to manage holding the meter and the sensor while also having to wield a tablet for notation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Needed an inexpensive device to measure light this worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Always Buying Something

customer_reviews.title: EXTECH LIGHT METER
customer_reviews.text: EXTECH has great equipment and the light meter works very well. Nice meter for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Keuhs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great device, very useful in night applications. Useful carrying case and very sensitive light sensor. Accurate reading device.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Extech 401027 Pocket Sized Candle Light Meter
customer_reviews.text: Being an avid amareur Orchid grower, I purchased this product to check light levels in both my greenhouse and glass house. In the past I have being using the light meter in my camera, which was very fiddly, requiring a reference to a conversion chart! The Extech light meter has made the process so much easier! Andrew Foster in Melbourne, Australia.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I purchased this light meter
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for growing orchids and deciding where to place a greenhouse. I am glad I purchased this light meter.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Creehan

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very good tool for lighting development and we will continue buying and issuing them to sales staff to use as field comparison tools.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: I needed to measure foot candles of light at my business
customer_reviews.text: The product did as advertised. Simple and easy to operate. It allowed me to put actual readings in a job quote for LED lighting retrofits.
customer_reviews.author: john finch

customer_reviews.title: It comes with an unmentioned case?
customer_reviews.text: I wasted $16 buying a case for this metter - Extech 409996.This listing either needs proper photos that show the case or at least include it in the description.

customer_reviews.title: Meter works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Meter works great for the price. Back lit screen is a great aid. Only issue is that meter turns off if left running for a period of time.
customer_reviews.author: TAH

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: can read low light levels at .1 dc's. Don't spend the extra money for more expensive devices. This is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Chip D.

customer_reviews.title: My first light meter. Good price, good item.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first light meter. I just use it for a final project decision, but I resolve our issues for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kkato

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. We use it to verify light consistency in our retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: Lee L Stockseth

customer_reviews.title: Works great and seems to be very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Works great and seems to be very sensitive. I like the "hold" feature which allows you to photograph the readout for record purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Morgan

customer_reviews.title: I dislike the fact that it looks more like a toy ...
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that it looks more like a toy than a professional instrument. Indeed, it doesn't look too steady while having in your hands. Not very good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

product_meta.title: Extech LT300 Light Meter
product_meta.description: Style:Standard Light MeterThe Extech LT300 light meter can determine whether you have adequate illumination to protect workers, students, visitors, patients or attendees of different venues. This handheld instrument measures up to 40, 000 fc (or 400, 000 lux) utilizing a remote light sensor connected via 12 in. Coiled cable (expandable to 24 in.). A prominent LCD readout displays a digital calculation and complementary analog bar graph for quick, reliable assessments. Complete with 9V battery, light sensor with protective cover, protective holster, and soft case. Insufficient lighting can create security risks or result in OSHA crackdowns.
feature_bullets: Backlight for readings in low light levels
Large LCD display with analog bargraph
Utilizes precision photo diode and color correction filter
Remote light sensor on 12" coiled cable - expandable to 24"

specifications.Warranty Description: Full one year warranty on parts and workmanship, unless otherwise specified. This warranty does not apply to defects resulting from action of the user such as misuse, improper wiring, operation outside of specification, improper maintenance or repair, or unauthorized modification.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars150 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
